#rstats friends please let me finally properly introduce {flow} !
Visualize as flow diagrams the logic and the execution of your code or browse through it as the diagram updates in real time.
https://t.co/gz06HbY5Xu
Feedback and visibility as always greatly appreciated! https://t.co/nzHrkTPPzD
Y'ALL. Making maps with #rstats and {sf} (even fictional maps!) is absurdly easy. Behold, Middle Earth in 26 lines of code! (code here: https://t.co/lC3ArRt4RC) https://t.co/SCrxAVAkjY

One non-serious thing I enjoy doing in #rstats is making pixel art. I create a dataframe of the x and y coordinates, code the colors, then plot it with ggplot2. Here's a pacman ghost I made https://t.co/03RQvHfQbX

This is a huge announcement that hasn't gotten much attention yet. #rstats users will finally be able to get their bar graphs with hatching:
Gradient fill, pattern fill, masks, and clipping paths in the R graphics engine. 
https://t.co/8KPDsPVFUv https://t.co/snDKSiBmlQ
